result.execSummary:
The defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to Count 2 and to any other sentence, with credit for 17 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: -Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

-Cooperate with agent. 
-Thinking for change course.
-Provide DNA Sample.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; no alcohol and drugs, unless prescribed; random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any bail on deposit remaining balance to be returned to the provider. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No contact with firearms.
- Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Count 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 17 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dushawn Montrell Vaden

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Dushawn Montrell Vaden.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 48 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 2 and to any other sentence, with credit for 17 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 24 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 48 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 17 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 24 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No new law violations. 
-Cooperate with agent. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; no alcohol and drugs, unless prescribed; random urine screens.
-Thinking for change course.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
-25 hours community service with non-profit organization.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any bail on deposit remaining balance to be returned to the provider. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions, Letter from Diana V., Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they are in a resolution posture. Court adjourns matter for a Plea/Sentencing date to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court via zoom, defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State, but need additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Patrol Officer Lane Olson for the City of West Allis Police Department. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden in court by video, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on call. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Dushawn Montrell Vaden in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dushawn Montrell Vaden appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
